articles.title: India and Pakistan's drone battles mark new arms race in Asia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas has agreed to a proposal by U.S. special envoy Steve Witkoff for a Gaza ceasefire, a Palestinian official close to the group told Reuters, paving the way for a possible end to the war.
articles.title: Hamas agrees to U.S. proposal on Gaza ceasefire, Palestinian official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A car ploughed into a crowd of Liverpool fans during a parade celebrating their side's Premier League soccer title on Monday, and police arrested a 53-year-old British man shortly afterwards.
articles.title: British man detained after car hits fans at Liverpool parade

articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The head of a U.S.-backed foundation said it could not uphold humanitarian principles amidst war.
articles.title: Head of US-backed Gaza aid foundation quits as further Israeli airstrikes kill dozens

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Tuesday flooding in the southeast posed "massive challenges" and the recovery would take several months.
articles.title: Australia floods recovery could take several months, PM says

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: President Donald Trump said Vladimir Putin had "gone absolutely CRAZY" by unleashing the largest aerial attack of the war on Ukraine and said he was considering more sanctions on Moscow, but he also scolded Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.
articles.title: Trump says Putin has 'gone absolutely CRAZY', considering more sanctions on Russia

articles.author: Jack Kim
articles.description: South Korea's liberal frontrunner for president Lee Jae-myung was leading his main conservative rival Kim Moon-soo by more than 10 percentage points in an opinion poll issued on Tuesday, though the race had tightened a week ahead of the election.
articles.title: South Korea's liberal candidate Lee holds clear lead a week before presidential vote

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian drone attacks injured three people in Ukraine's south and southeast overnight, Ukrainian officials said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Three people injured in Russian attacks in Ukraine's south, southeast, officials says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Maryland congressman said on Monday he was unable to meet one of his constituents, a Salvadoran man wrongly deported from the United States to a prison in El Salvador.
articles.title: Maryland congressman denied access to see man wrongly deported to El Salvador

articles.author: Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: The demonstrators shouted nationalistic slogans and called for violence against Palestinians.
articles.title: Far-right Israelis confront Palestinians, other Israelis in chaotic Jerusalem march, witnesses say
